Descriptiontitle>
systemd-remount-fs.servicefilename> is an early boot service that applies mount options listed in fstabrefentrytitle>5 to the root file system, the <filenameusr file system, and the kernel API file systems. This is required so that the mount options of these file systems — which are pre-mounted by the kernel, the initial RAM disk, container environments or system manager code — are updated to those listed in <filenameetc/fstab. This service ignores normal file systems and only changes the root file system (i.e. <filename), /usr and the virtual kernel API file systems such as <filenameproc, <filenamesys or /dev. This service executes no operation if <filenameetc/fstab does not exist or lists no entries for the mentioned file systems.para>
For a longer discussion of kernel API file systems see API File Systemsulink>. refsect1>
